channel.title: MSDN Just Published
channel.description: Keep current with all the new technical articles, columns, specifications, and resources published on the Microsoft Developer Network (MSDN).

item.title: .NET Rocks! - Live from the Canadian Vista Launch Events!
item.description: Carl and Richard were the emcees at the Toronto, Montreal, and Ottawa launch events in December, 2006. Hear them and their guests Shane Miskin, Scott Howlett, Allan Vander-spek, Mohammad Akif, Robert Achmann, Jean-Luc David, and Tony Davidson.
item.dc:creator: Carl Franklin

item.title: Download: SharePoint Server 2007 Videos: Enterprise Search Deep Dive Labs
item.description: This download provides six detailed presentations on enterprise search in Microsoft Office SharePoint Server 2007.
item.dc:creator: Microsoft Corporation

item.title: Guide to InfoPath 2007 Developer Documentation
item.description: Learn about the object models and development options available in Office InfoPath 2007, and find out where the conceptual, procedural, and class library reference topics are located.
item.dc:creator: Mark Roberts

item.title: Extending SQL Server Reporting Services with SQL CLR Table-Valued Functions
item.description: This article describes how to take advantage of SQL common language runtime (CLR) table-valued functions to combine different types of data sources to create rich and exciting Microsoft SQL Server 2005 Reporting Services reports.
item.dc:creator: Ryan Ackley

item.title: Visual Studio 2005 Tools for Office Sample: Deploying Visual Studio 2005 Tools for Office Solutions Using Windows Installer
item.description: Learn how to deploy a Microsoft Visual Studio 2005 Tools for the Microsoft Office System solution using a Visual Studio 2005 Setup project to create a Windows Installer package.
item.dc:creator: Microsoft Corporation

item.title: Deploying Visual Studio 2005 Tools for Office Solutions Using Windows Installer (Part 1 of 2)
item.description: Learn how to deploy a Microsoft Visual Studio 2005 Tools for the Microsoft Office System solution using a Visual Studio 2005 Setup project to create a Windows Installer package.
item.dc:creator: Darryn Lavery

item.title: Visual How to: Use Office Open XML File Formats to Retrieve a List of Excel 2007 Worksheets
item.description: Describes how to retrieve a list of all the worksheets within an Excel workbook or set of workbooks using Open XML File Formats.
item.dc:creator: Ken Getz

item.title: Visual How to: Office Open XML Formats: Retrieving Excel 2007 Cell Values
item.description: Describes how to retrieve information about a specific cell within an Excel workbook or set of workbooks using Office Open XML Formats.
item.dc:creator: Ken Getz

item.title: Sample: 2007 Office Sample: Setting Up a Development Environment
item.description: This code sample accompanies the MDN technical article, "Setting Up a Development Environment for the 2007 Microsoft Office System." To view this article, click the link in Related Resources.
item.dc:creator: Alex Hart and Bryan Hart

item.title: Setting Up a Development Environment for the 2007 Microsoft Office System
item.description: Learn to create a development environment for the 2007 Microsoft Office System. See examples of common application solutions that you can create using this system.
item.dc:creator: Alex Hart and Bryan Hart

item.title: OfficeTalk: Conditional Formatting: Adding Customized Rules to Excel 2007
item.description: The conditional formatting user interface (UI) in Excel 2007 now makes it easier than ever to create rules that increase the impact of your data. Learn how to take advantage of the powerful conditional formatting options from the UI and programmatically.
item.dc:creator: Frank Rice

item.title: Free Windows Vista Ultimate for All MIX07 Attendees
item.description: April 30 - May 2, Las Vegas, NV: Join the world's top Web developers, designers, and thinkers at MIX07 for a discussion on the Next Web Now. Register today and get a copy of Windows Vista Ultimate for free.

item.title: .NET Rocks! - Ted Neward on Interoperability
item.description: Ted Neward discusses the present state and future of interoperability. Java and .NET compatibility are discussed and Ted touches on a wide range of topics ranging from XML's shortcomings as a messenger format to proprietary systems in .NET 3.0.
item.dc:creator: Carl Franklin

item.title: Tutorial 12: Using TemplateFields in the GridView Control (VB)
item.description: This tutorial examines how to use TemplateField to achieve a greater degree of customization with GridView. This tutorial looks also at another way to customize the formatting based on underlying data: by calling formatting methods from within a template.
item.dc:creator: Scott Mitchell

item.title: Feature Changes in ASP.NET 2.0
item.description: If you are considering migrating from ASP or ASP.NET 1.x, you should consider the advantages provided by new features in ASP.NET 2.0. Thise article provides a feature-based overview of ASP.NET 2.0 for developers familiar with ASP or ASP.NET 1.1.

item.title: Download: 2007 Office Sample: Visual Studio Visual Basic Code Snippets for the Office Fluent UI
item.description: Download this package to install Office Fluent UI code snippets for use with Visual Studio 2005.
item.dc:creator: Microsoft Corporation

item.title: Tutorial 17: Examining the Events Associated with Inserting, Updating, and Deleting (VB)
item.description: Extend the built-in inserting, updating, and deleting capabilities of ASP.NET data Web controls, and customize the editing interface to only update a subset of the product fields, with this tutorial from Scott Mitchell.
item.dc:creator: Scott Mitchell

item.title: Win Cool Home Music Gear with MSDN Flash
item.description: Customize your MSDN Flash newsletter today and you’ll be automatically entered to win a chance for cool home music gear like a new Microsoft Zune™ or a wireless home digital music system from Sonos!
item.dc:creator: MSDN

item.title: Embed video on a web page using "WPF/E"
item.description: Learn how to create a service that allows you to embed video on a blog or other web page using the WPF/E technology.

item.title: Windows Live SDK
item.description: The Windows Live SDK is now available to web developers and contains API's and services such as Search, AdCenter and Virtual Earth.

item.title: Beginner Developer Learning Center launched!
item.description: The Beginner Developer Learning Center is a site designed specifically for beginning programmers and contains over 50 lessons and how-to tutorials that start with the absolute basics. Now anyone can learn to program!

item.title: Deploying Visual Studio 2005 Tools for Office Second Edition Solutions Using Windows Installer: Walkthroughs (Part 2 of 2)
item.description: Read two walkthroughs about deploying Microsoft Visual Studio 2005 Tools for the Microsoft Office System solutions using a Visual Studio 2005 Setup project to create a Windows Installer package.
item.dc:creator: Darryn Lavery

item.title: Improving a Graphics Application with Tablet APIs
item.description: Demonstrates how to write an application for colorizing digital photos using the inking support provided by Tablet PC APIs.
item.dc:creator: Stephen Toub

item.title: Foundations: Tracking Services in Windows Workflow Foundation
item.description: Learn all about one of the core features in Windows Workflow Foundation: Tracking Services.
item.dc:creator: Matt Milner

item.title: Bugslayer: GUI Control to Major Tom
item.description: This month John Robbins illustrates the use of the UI Automation tools and APIs to achieve more reliable automated GUI testing.
item.dc:creator: John Robbins

item.title: Service Station: BizTalk Server 2006 Web Services
item.description: This month Aaron Skonnard introduces the exciting world of BizTalk Server 2006 and its support for today’s Web services technologies.
item.dc:creator: Aaron Skonnard

item.title: Wicked Code: Scalable Apps with Asynchronous Programming in ASP.NET
item.description: ASP.NET supports three asynchronous programming models that keep your thread pool sparkling clean. See how to implement them here.
item.dc:creator: Jeff Prosise

item.title: Cutting Edge: Validating ASP.NET Query Strings
item.description: If your ASP.NET pages use query string parameters, you need to ensure that they are properly validated before use. Here Dino Esposito shows how.
item.dc:creator: Dino Esposito

item.title: Test Run: Testing Custom Transform Streams
item.description: This month: key techniques you can use to test custom stream classes that transform data read from or written to another stream.
item.dc:creator: Dr. James McCaffrey

item.title: CLR Inside Out: .NET Application Extensibility, Part 2
item.description: This month the authors discuss the System.AddIn pipeline and show how to ensure compatibility as your host and add-in change versions independently.
item.dc:creator: Jack Gudenkauf and Jesse Kaplan

item.title: Concurrent Affairs: Implementing the CLR Asynchronous Programming Model
item.description: Jeffrey Richter illustrates how to design classes to implement the CLR’s Asynchronous Programming Model for more efficient I/O operations.
item.dc:creator: Jeffrey Richter

item.title: {End Bracket}: Developing the Virtual Earth 3D Control
item.description: Everything you wanted to know about the Virtual Earth 3D control.
item.dc:creator: Duncan Lawler

item.title: Toolbox: Share Your Desktop, Lightweight Code Editing, and More
item.description: Toolbox: Share Your Desktop, Lightweight Code Editing, and More
item.dc:creator: Scott Mitchell

item.title: Editor's Note: Bring On the Swag
item.description: Editor's Note: Bring On the Swag
item.dc:creator: Joshua Trupin

item.title: ASP.NET 2.0: Manage Web Users With Custom Profile Providers
item.description: In ASP.NET 2.0, profile providers allow you to manage users more efficiently. Learn how to create your own.
item.dc:creator: Jason N. Gaylord

item.title: WiX Tricks: Automate Releases With MSBuild And Windows Installer XML
item.description: Achieve an automated build and release process using the Microsoft Build Engine (MSBuild) and the Windows Installer XML (WiX) toolset.
item.dc:creator: Sayed Ibrahim Hashimi

item.title: Digital Media: Add Video To Controls And 3D Surfaces With WPF
item.description: Learn about Windows Presentation Foundation media integration so you can add media files and dazzling visuals to your own apps.
item.dc:creator: Lee Brimelow

item.title: .NET Security: Support Certificates In Your Applications With The .NET Framework 2.0
item.description: This article takes a tour of certificates in general, looks at the Windows Certificate Store, and discusses the certificate APIs of the .NET Framework 2.0.
item.dc:creator: Dominick Baier

item.title: IIS 7.0: Explore The Web Server For Windows Vista And Beyond
item.description: IIS 7.0 takes the speed, reliability, and security of IIS 6.0 and turns it into a highly extensible and manageable Web server to run Web apps of the future.
item.dc:creator: Mike Volodarsky

item.title: Sample: InfoPath 2007 Sample: Training Labs
item.description: Step-by-step training and downloadable samples illustrating Microsoft Office InfoPath 2007 features.
item.dc:creator: Microsoft Corporation

item.title: Model-Driven Development (Part 2)
item.description: Part two of an ARCast chat transcript on model-driven development.
item.dc:creator: Harry Pierson, Martin Danner, Jack Greenfield, Steven Kelly, Brian Selic

item.title: Model-Driven Development (Part 1)
item.description: Part one of an ARCast chat transcript on model-driven development.
item.dc:creator: Harry Pierson, Martin Danner, Jack Greenfield, Mauro Regio, Brian Selic

item.title: Real Frameworks for a Service-Oriented World
item.description: Provide customers with better value and more predicable results with tools and practices discussed in this article about Capgemini tools.
item.dc:creator: Joel Jeffery

item.title: Building Sustainable Banking Architectures
item.description: This paper describes the Loan-Origination RAP & uses a banking scenario to focus on some of the specific needs for financial services. This scenario will provide means for partners & customers to integrate banking applications & establish consistency.
item.dc:creator: Mike Walker

item.title: Consumer-Driven Contracts: A Service Evolution Pattern
item.description: This article discusses some of the challenges in evolving a community of service providers and consumers.
item.dc:creator: Ian Robinson

item.title: Video: Visual How to: Using Office Open XML File Formats to Retrieve a List of Excel 2007 Worksheets
item.description: Describes how to retrieve a list of worksheets in Excel 2007.
item.dc:creator: Ken Getz

item.title: Video: Visual How to: Office Open XML Formats: Setting Custom Word 2007 Document Properties
item.description: Describes how to set custom properties in Word 2007
item.dc:creator: Ken Getz

item.title: Video: Visual How to: Office Open XML Formats: Retrieving Excel 2007 Cell Values
item.description: Demonstrates how to retrieve values from an Excel 2007 worksheet.
item.dc:creator: Ken Getz

item.title: Video: Visual How to: Office Open XML Formats: Retrieving Lists of PowerPoint 2007 Slides
item.description: Demonstrates how to retrieve a list of PowerPoint 2007 slide titles.
item.dc:creator: Ken Getz

item.title: Beginner Developer Lessons for Visual Studio 2005 Express Editions
item.description: This beginner’s guide is designed for people with little or no prior knowledge of computer programming, who want to create computer programs with the Visual Studio Express tools.
item.dc:creator: Rich Tebb, Content Master Ltd

item.title: Use XPath Explorer to Unlock Data in Word 2007 XML Files
item.description: XPath Explorer is a new tool that you can use to view the XML element hierarchy in any XML file, including Word 2003 and Word 2007 XML files.
item.dc:creator: Bill Coan

item.title: Save 20% on Advanced Development with .NET 2.0 E-Learning
item.description: Take the Advanced Development with the Microsoft .NET Framework 2.0 Foundation collection, and get discounts on related e-learning courses.

item.title: Excel 2007 Week Numbering Systems and DateTime Implementations
item.description: Learn about the four different week-numbering systems available in Microsoft Office Excel and how to use them. Also learn why it is important to implement the date and time representation of the ISO8601:2000 standard in your Excel applications.
item.dc:creator: Ron de Bruin, Norman Harker, Frank Rice

item.title: Microsoft Office Access 2007 Developer Reference
item.description: This reference contains conceptual overviews, programming tasks, samples, and references to guide you in developing solutions based on Access.
item.dc:creator: Microsoft Corporation

item.title: Microsoft RTC Client API (Update)
item.description: The RTC Client API enables you to build applications that can make PC-PC, PC-phone, or phone-phone calls or create Instant Messaging (IM) sessions over the Internet.
item.dc:creator: Microsoft Corporation

item.title: Download: Office 2003: XML Schema Reference (update)
item.description: This download contains documentation on a number of XML schemas for Microsoft Office 2003 Editions.
item.dc:creator: Microsoft Corporation

item.title: Lab 12: Using SharePoint Server Workflows with InfoPath 2007
item.description: Learn how to create Web pages in Visual Studio 2005 that include links that open InfoPath 2007 forms. Add query parameters to the URL to control how the form behaves, and create a custom page that displays InfoPath forms and ASP.NET controls together.
item.dc:creator: Mike Talley

item.title: Lab 11: Integrating InfoPath 2007 Forms in Web Sites Using Visual Studio
item.description: Learn how to create Web pages in Visual Studio 2005 that include links that open InfoPath 2007 forms. Add query parameters to the URL to control how the form behaves, and create a custom page that displays InfoPath forms and ASP.NET controls together.
item.dc:creator: Mike Talley

item.title: Lab 10: Creating and Inserting InfoPath Template Parts
item.description: Learn how you can create an InfoPath 2007 form template that can be filled out by using a Web browser on a mobile device and then submitted to a SharePoint library.
item.dc:creator: Mike Talley

item.title: Lab 9: Designing InfoPath 2007 Forms for Mobile Web Browsers
item.description: Learn how you can create an InfoPath 2007 form template that can be filled out by using a Web browser on a mobile device and then submitted to an Office SharePoint Server library.
item.dc:creator: Mike Talley

item.title: The .NET Show, Episode 60: Office Live
item.description: The .NET Show hosts Rajesh Jha, Corporate Vice President for Office Live, and Tara Brown, lead program manager for Office Live, to talk about how this new service empowers small business.
item.dc:creator: Robert Hess

item.title: Lab 8: Using the InfoPath 2007 Object Model and Visual Studio Tools for Applications
item.description: Learn how to use the Microsoft Visual Studio Tools for Applications (VSTA) development environment to write managed-code business logic against the Office InfoPath 2007 object model.
item.dc:creator: Mike Talley

item.title: Lab 7: Restricting Permissions to Forms and Form Templates
item.description: Learn how to restrict permissions to a form and a form template by applying user rights.
item.link: Lab 7: Restricting Permissions to InfoPath 2007 Forms and Form Templates
item.dc:creator: Mike Talley

item.title: Lab 6: Using InfoPath 2007 E-mail Forms
item.description: Learn how to use InfoPath e-mail forms to deploy, collect, and analyze information. You will also learn how to use property promotion to group and sort information in Outlook folders, and how to use form information for more detailed analysis.
item.dc:creator: Mike Talley

item.title: Lab 5: Importing Word Forms into InfoPath 2007
item.description: Learn how to convert your existing Microsoft Word documents into InfoPath forms to take advantage of the InfoPath form design and form-filling features.
item.dc:creator: Mike Talley

item.title: Lab 4: Enabling Digital Signatures in InfoPath 2007 Form Templates
item.description: Learn how to enable digital signatures in an InfoPath form so that users can sign the form in Microsoft Office InfoPath 2007 or in Internet Explorer.
item.dc:creator: Mike Talley

item.title: Lab 3: Integrating InfoPath 2007 with the Data Connection Library
item.description: Learn how to use Universal Data Connection (UDC) files in a Data Connection Library (DCL) to provide data connection settings to Microsoft Office InfoPath 2007 form templates for use in both client and server forms.
item.dc:creator: Mike Talley

item.title: Deploying and Managing InfoPath 2007 Forms
item.description: Learn how to deploy a form template to a server running fsfssvcs12. You will also learn about several form management activities.
item.dc:creator: Mike Talley

item.title: Lab 1: Publishing a Form Template to a Server Running InfoPath 2007 Forms Services
item.description: Learn how to create a browser-enabled InfoPath 2007 form template, review the different server-specific options, and publish the form template to a SharePoint Server 2007 document library.
item.dc:creator: Mike Talley

item.title: Working with Excel Workbooks and Worksheets in E-Mail
item.description: Microsoft Excel MVP Ron de Bruin provides a number of samples and a handy add-in that enhances your experience when working with e-mail from Excel.
item.dc:creator: Ron de Bruin, Frank Rice

item.title: Video: Visual How To: Office Open XML Formats: Replacing PowerPoint 2007 Slide Images
item.description: Describes how to replace PowerPoint slide images using Office Open XML Formats
item.dc:creator: Ken Getz

item.title: Download: Office Live Code Sample: Time Card
item.description: Time Card sample code for Microsoft Office Live which is designed to track and record time spent on tasks included in an Office Live Project Manager application.
item.dc:creator: Microsoft Corporation

item.title: Outlook 2007 Developer Reference
item.description: This reference contains conceptual overviews, programming tasks, samples, and references to guide you in developing solutions based on Outlook.
item.dc:creator: Microsoft Corporation

item.title: InfoPath 2007 Sample: Using IOLECommands with the COM-Based InfoPathEditor Object
item.description: These downloads contain the full Visual C# and Visual C++ source code of Windows applications that mirror the functionality of the Microsoft Office InfoPath 2007 form editing environment.
item.dc:creator: Microsoft Corporation

item.title: Microsoft Office Project 2007 Developer Reference
item.description: The Microsoft Office Project 2007 Developer Reference contains conceptual overviews, programming tasks, samples, and references to guide you in developing solutions based on Microsoft Office Project.
item.dc:creator: Microsoft Corporation

item.title: Microsoft Office SharePoint Designer 2007 Developer Reference
item.description: This reference contains conceptual overviews, programming tasks, samples, and references to guide you in developing solutions based on Microsoft Office SharePoint Designer.
item.dc:creator: Microsoft Corporation

item.title: Pragmatic Architecture: User Interface
item.description: Moore's Law is responsible for a growing range of power and capability in the UIs of the applications we build. This power brings a tremendous flexibility in the technologies for building applications, but the flexibility brings a daunting responsibility.
item.dc:creator: Ted Neward

item.title: Disabling Tablet PC Input Panel
item.description: Use registry keys to disable the Tablet PC Input panel for a simple way to patch previously released software in which Input Panel interferes with the interaction model or other aspects of your application.
item.dc:creator: Tracy Schultz

item.title: ASP.NET Data Tutorial 11: Custom Formatting Based Upon Data (Visual Basic)
item.description: Adjusting the format of GridView, DetailsView, or FormView based upon data bound to it can be accomplished in multiple ways. This tutorial looks at how to accomplish data-bound formatting through the use of DataBound and RowDataBound event handlers.
item.dc:creator: Scott Mitchell

item.title: Tutorial 12: Using TemplateFields in the GridView Control (C#)
item.description: This tutorial examines how to use TemplateField to achieve a greater degree of customization with GridView. This tutorial looks also at another way to customize the formatting based on underlying data: by calling formatting methods from within a template.
item.dc:creator: Scott Mitchell

item.title: Tutorial 11: Custom Formatting Based Upon Data (C#)
item.description: Adjusting the format of GridView, DetailsView, or FormView based upon data bound to it can be accomplished in multiple ways. This tutorial will look at how to accomplish data-bound formatting through the use of DataBound and RowDataBound event handlers.
item.dc:creator: Scott Mitchell

item.title: New specifications enable browser-based Web Single Sign-On (SSO) between security domains that use Liberty ID-FF and WS-Federation
item.description: Customer feedback has driven the development of two specs to enable browser-based Web single sign-on across domains. The Web Single Sign-On Interoperability Profile and Web Single Sign-On Metadata Exchange Protocol specs define interoperability between Liberty Identity Federation and WS-Federation for WebSSO.
item.dc:creator: Microsoft et al

item.title: Where Did My Icons Go?
item.description: Review the host of improvements and new features that make the Microsoft Visual Studio 2005 integrated development environment (IDE) even more impressive than its predecessors.
item.dc:creator: Devin Rader

item.title: The Laws of Identity
item.description: Defining a set of fundamental principles to which any universally adopted, sustainable identity architecture must conform, the "Laws of Identity" were proposed, debated, and refined through an open and continuing dialogue on the Internet.
item.dc:creator: Kim Cameron

item.title: Microsoft's Vision for an Identity Metasystem
item.description: The Identity Metasystem is an interoperable architecture for digital identity that assumes people will have several digital identities based on multiple underlying technologies, implementations, and providers.
item.dc:creator: Microsoft Corp.

item.title: Improving Application Performance by Implementing Paginated Lists
item.description: Describes how Ameripay has implemented the "How To: Page Records in .NET Applications" section of the Microsoft patterns & practices book Improving .NET Application Performance and Scalability.
item.dc:creator: Chuck Cooper

item.title: Data Cleansing Applications with SQL Server Integration Services
item.description: Data quality is a critical issue in data integration. Donald Farmer introduces the data quality features of SQL Server Integration Services with demos that show how to use the Fuzzy Lookup component for inexact matching and how to use Data Mining within the data integration process.
item.dc:creator: Donald Farmer

item.title: What's New for Developers in Windows Mobile 5.0
item.description: Learn about the new features in Windows Mobile version 5.0 from a developer's perspective.
item.dc:creator: Jim Wilson

item.title: Introducing Windows Mobile 5.0
item.description: Get ready for next generation Windows Mobile-based devices. Learn about technologies for native and managed application developers, and download tools to start building Windows Mobile 5.0 applications.
item.dc:creator: ericeng

item.title: WS-Security Interoperability Using WSE 2.0 and Sun JWSDP 1.5
item.description: Learn about interoperability based on OASIS WS-Security 1.0 between Microsoft WSE 2.0 and Sun JWSDP 1.5.
item.dc:creator: Simon Guest

item.title: Windows Mobile 5.0 Application Security
item.description: Learn how to develop an application for a Windows Mobile based device, including how to determine what the security configuration of your device is, and how to sign your application with the appropriate certificate.
item.dc:creator: Jason Fuller

item.title: What's New in Visual Studio 2005 for Native Developers
item.description: Learn about the Visual Studio 2005 native device development feature set. It is intended for both eMbedded Visual C++ developers who want to learn about the successor to eMbedded Visual C++, in addition to desktop computer C++ developers who want to learn about targeting device platforms with their native applications.
item.dc:creator: Nishan Jebanasam

item.title: Migrating Microsoft eMbedded Visual C++ Projects to Visual Studio 2005
item.description: Use this guide to assist you in migrating your Microsoft eMbedded Visual C++ version 3.0 and eMbedded Visual C++ version 4.0 projects to Microsoft Visual Studio 2005.
item.dc:creator: Nishan Jebanasam

item.title: .NET Rocks! - Dot Net Nuke 3.0
item.description: We return to Dot Net Nuke, with Jim Duffy and Shaun Walker, who talk about the amazing ability to support plug-ins and skins on Dot Net Nuke. We discuss the changes between 2.0 and 3.0, the philosophy of Open Source development, and get a glimpse at the future of Dot Net Nuke.
item.dc:creator: Carl Franklin

item.title: Cookieless ASP.NET
item.description: Dino reviews the pros and cons of cookieless sessions in ASP.NET and discusses why you should avoid storing valuable information in the session state.
item.dc:creator: Dino Esposito

item.title: SQL Server for Developers: Detecting and Resolving Stalled and Stuck I/O Issues in SQL Server 2000 SP4
item.description: SQL Server 2000 SP4 significantly reduces the time it takes to identify and determine the underlying cause of I/O issues.
item.dc:creator: Robert Dorr

item.title: skmFAQs.NET: An ASP.NET FAQ Application
item.description: Scott Mitchell presents a case study of ASPFAQs.com, followed by an overview of skmFAQs.NET, an ASP.NET 1.x application for allowing a defined group of individuals to publish information online.
item.dc:creator: Scott Mitchell

item.title: Table of Contents: GridView Examples for ASP.NET 2.0
item.description: Accomplish a number of common tasks with the Microsoft ASP.NET 2.0 GridView control. Each task is accompanied by a description of the new concepts covered.
item.dc:creator: Scott Mitchell

item.title: Hackers Beware: Keep Bad Guys at Bay with the Advanced Security Features in SQL Server 2005
item.description: Explore security enhancements in SQL Server 2005 from a developer's perspective: endpoint authentication, support for the security context of managed code that executes on the server, and much more.
item.dc:creator: Don Kiely
